intro: Hampea reynae, commonly known as the Reyna's hampea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, palmate leaves, and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
